title: What is the origin of the term YEG? - Quora
tags: What Is the Origin of X?

response.answer_text: It doesn’t seem to have any meaning, excepting the “Y” initial which is usually used for Canadian airports. Edmonton has had several airports over the last century, and apparently C and D have made appearances in Namao or downtown, but otherwise the EG ending seems quite random and is not an acronym. My father has lived in Edmonton since 1956, and I was born and lived there for more than three decades. I have never heard of an Edmontonian call him or herself a Yegger. Someone might have been teasing the OP.

YEG is the airport code for Edmonton International Airport. The use of a leading Y for "most" Canadian airports is a convention of the IATA (International Air Transport Association), which assigns the three-letter codes. The last two letters are supposed to have some bearing to the local city.
